Articles.Content:
Hi there!

I've got KSP bought over Steam and I am playing for quiet a long time now.

I started a new Career (in 0.25 its the complete thing ergo no "sandbox", or just "science"). This Career lasts for 14 years and some days by now..

Now I recognized that no asteroids are spawning when I am at the Tracking Station and looking for "Unknown Objects".

I googled the problem, but it seems noone else has got that problem. I tried starting a new "Career", a new "Sandbox" game and a "Science" game as well... No asteroids at all.

Starting a Training Mission which is called "Asteroid redirect mission" brings me up in an universe without any asteroids. The scenario called "Asteroid something" spawns no Asteroid to track/fly to.

My KSP version is 0.25.0.642

Did I missed the fact that there arent any asteroids any more? Or do I need some special download for this?

Thanks for your aswers!

Volodja123

First, check your Kerbal Space Program folder to see if the NasaMission folder is where it ought to be -- in GameData.

Second, have Steam run an integrity check (Steam Library -> Right-click on KSP and select Properties -> Go to the Local Files tab -> Verify Integrity of Game Cache).

Third, if those do not solve the issue, please post some logs.

I checked both things. All right.

Should I post you the KSP.log?

See here, it'll point you in the right direction for the log. (It's actually output_log.txt) http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92230-Stock-Support-Bug-Reporting-Guide

Also, further in the NASA folder there should be a Potatoroid folder (with some files in it).

Do you have any add-ons installed? It's possible they are interfering.

Cheers

-Claw

Yes, I have Kerbal Engineer, Alarm Clock, Mechjeb2 and Hyper Edit.. Is there a list of interfering Mods?

In the NASA folder there is a Potatoroid folder with files in it.

How many lines do you need out of the log? The last 1000? Because it has 29k lines :/

Ok I think I found the problem.

Ive got the Dark Multiplayer Mod installed, and I think this is interfering with the Asteroids.

I crosschecked it with some other guys right now, it seems to be that way..

I will let you know if its for real!

Ok, I definitly found out that its a problem with the Dark Multiplayer Mod.. I had it in the latest Dev Version.

Thanks so much for your hint with the mods!

Best regards, Volodja

No sweat. Moving this to the modded support forum in case someone else needs to learn from it.

Welcome to the forums.

~Claw

Had the same issue of no asteroids spawning, but totally unrelated to Dark Multiplayer, so made a search (with some help from Nathankell) and found the CactEye add-on being responsible (at least, with KSP 0.25 642 Win32).

I'm mentioning it in case others come to this thread for help with the issue in title.
